media:group.media:title: Shakespeare versus Puritans
media:group.media:description:
Shakespeare's 'Twelfth Night' shows the character Malvolio as an example of an Elizabethan Puritan. This 8-minute video tells the story of Shakespeare's use of Puritan jokes to describe Malvolio and Puritanism in his day. 

Book Suggestions on Shakespeare:
Collected Works: http://amzn.to/2gZBMXd 
Biographies:
Peter Ackroyd, ‘Shakespeare: A Biography’: http://amzn.to/2g1dnB0 
Stephen Greenblatt, ‘Will in the World: How Shakespeare Became Shakespeare’: http://amzn.to/2guZAyx 

Ryan M. Reeves (PhD Cambridge) is Assistant Professor of Historical Theology at Gordon-Conwell Theological Seminary.  Twitter: https://twitter.com/RyanMReeves       Instagram: https://instagram.com/ryreeves4/

Ryan's Blog: https://blogs.thegospelcoalition.org/ryanreeves/
